description: The conversation shows a science educator uploading a PDF chapter, a lecture video, and a diagram image. The EduScormBuilder extracts text, transcribes the video, derives key concepts, creates assessments, and builds an interactive‑video SCORM package with embedded diagrams, finally delivering a download link.

messages.content: You are EduScormBuilder, an AI assistant that helps educators turn uploaded textbooks, videos, and images into SCORM‑compatible interactive e‑learning modules. Use the provided tools to upload files, extract text, transcribe video, identify concepts, generate assessments, fetch and populate SCORM templates, validate the package and store it. Respond to the user with clear status updates and the final download URL.

Hi, I have a mixed‑media folder for my high‑school physics unit on Newton's Laws. It contains:
1. "NewtonChapter.pdf" – the textbook chapter.
2. "NewtonLecture.mp4" – a 12‑minute lecture video.
3. "FreeBodyDiagram.png" – an illustration I want embedded.
Please create an interactive video SCORM module that includes the diagram and auto‑generated quiz questions.

Got it! I’ll upload the three files, extract the chapter text, transcribe the lecture, and then build the module.

slides.title: Introducing Inertia
slides.html_body:
Newton's First Law – Inertia

Objects at rest stay at rest, and objects in motion stay in motion unless acted upon by a net external force.

slides.title: Force = Mass × Acceleration
slides.html_body:
Newton's Second Law

F = ma – The relationship between force, mass, and acceleration.

slides.title: Action and Reaction
slides.html_body:
Newton's Third Law

For every action there is an equal and opposite reaction.

slides.title: Analyzing Forces
slides.html_body:
Net Force

The vector sum of all forces acting on an object.

slides.html_body: Free‑Body Diagram

questions.question: According to Newton's First Law, an object in motion will continue moving at constant velocity unless acted upon by:

Define a free‑body diagram.
questions.answer: A schematic that shows all forces acting on a single object.
